metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29535 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Following a Garbage Collector compaction, weak maps may have been accessedbefore they were correctly traced. This resulted in memory corruption and apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 112,Focus for Android < 112, Firefox ESR < 102.10, Firefox for Android < 112,and Thunderbird < 102.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
